Department of Entomology, China Agricultural University, Beijing 100094, China Department of Entomology, Royal Belgian Institute of Natural Sciences, Vautierstraat 29, B- 1000 Brussels, Belgium (* corresponding author)

heading.emphasis:
Key to species (males) of
Chrysotimus Loew
from China

paragraph.keyLead: 1. Hind tarsomere 1 without black ventral bristles at base................................................ 2
­ Hind tarsomere 1 with black ventral bristles at base .................................................... 3

2. Epandrium with truncate apex, lateral process on epandrium thick and truncate ( Fig. 25 )... Guangxi ..........................................
Chrysotimus guangxiensis Yang and Saigusa

­ Epandrium with acute apex, lateral process on epandrium with deep incision apically ( Fig. 46 ) ... China ...............................................................
Chrysotimus sinensis Parent
­ Arista sub­apical or apical; epandrium with thin finger­like process ( Figs. 6 , 8 , 13 ) .. 5

5. Antennal scape and pedicel yellow ... Zhejiang ..............
Chrysotimus basiflavus Yang
7. Hind tarsomere 1 with more than 14 black ventral bristles at base............................... 8
­ Hind tarsomere 1 with less than 12 black ventral bristles at base................................. 9

8. Hind tarsomere 1 with 22 black ventral bristles at base; surstylus on epandrium not furcated apically, cercus broad with acute apex ( Fig. 15 ) ... Gansu ...............................
........................................................................................... Chrysotimus chikuni
sp. nov.

­ Hind tarsomere 1 with 14–16 black ventral bristles at base; surstylus on epandrium with deeply furcated apex, cercus round ( Fig. 59 ) ... Guangxi .......................................
............................................................................................... Chrysotimus xuae
sp. nov.

9. Hind tarsomere 1 with 3–4 black ventral bristles at base; surstylus basally without inner process ... Beijing
.............................................. Chrysotimus songshanus
sp. nov.

­ Hind tarsomere 1 with about 10 black ventral bristles at base; surstylus basally with inner process ( Figs. 12 , 44 ) ........................................................................................ 10

10. Hairs and bristles on thorax dark brown; hind tibia with 1 ad; surstylus on epandrium apically round, without apical incision ( Fig. 13 )... Yunnan ........................................... .........................................................................
Chrysotimus bispinus Yang and Saigusa

­ Hairs and bristles on thorax yellow; hind tibia with 2 ad; surstylus on epandrium apically acute, with apical incision ( Fig. 45 ) ... Hubei, Shaanxi, Yunnan ........................... .............................................................
Chrysotimus shennongjianus Yang and Saigusa
12. Hind tarsomere 1 with 4–8 sparse black ventral bristles at base ................................ 13
­ Hind tarsomere 1 with 1 or 2 bundles of dense black ventral bristles at base ........... 14

13. R 4+5 and M slightly convergent apically; hind tarsomere 1 with 2 bundles of black ventral bristles at base; epandrium with short and broad process, surstylus with broad apex ( Fig. 10 ) ... Shaanxi .........................................
Chrysotimus bifascia Yang and Saigusa

­
R 4
+5 and M parallel apically; hind tarsomere 1 with bundle of black ventral bristles at base; epandrium with long and acute process, surstylus with acute apex ( Fig. 51 ) ... Shaanxi, Yunnan ............................................
Chrysotimus unifascia Yang and Saigusa

14. Hind tarsomere 1 without rowed v; epandrium with round process, both surstylus and cercus with round apex ( Fig. 61 ) ... Yunnan .................................................................. ..................................................................
Chrysotimus yunlonganus Yang and Saigusa

15. Hairs and bristles on thorax brown; epandrium with long process (longer than epandrium), surstylus on epandrium furcated apically ( Fig. 40 ) ... Guangxi ........................
............................................................................. Chrysotimus sanjiangyuanus
sp. nov.

­ Hairs and bristles on thorax yellow; epandrium without long process, surstylus on epandrium not furcated apically.................................................................................. 16

16. Hind femur with row of ad and pd; hind tarsomere 1 with 4 black ventral bristles; cercus long and narrow ( Fig. 56 ) ... Beijing ........................................................................ ..............................................
Chrysotimus xiaolongmensis Zhang, Yang and Grootaert

17. Hind tarsomere 1 with 6 erect short black ventral bristles at base; epandrium with bifurcated process, cercus with broad base and acute apex ( Fig. 4 ) ... Guangdong ........
......................................................................................... Chrysotimus acutatus
sp. nov.

­ Hind tarsomere 1 with 8 erect short black ventral bristles at base; epandrium with acute process; cercus round ( Fig. 23 ) ... Guangdong
... Chrysotimus guangdongensis
sp. nov.

18. First flagellomere subtriangular, as long as wide; surstylus and cercus slender ( Fig. 34 ) ... Ningxia
.................................................................... Chrysotimus ningxianus
sp. nov.

20. Hind tarsomere 1 with 10–12 black ventral basal bristles; mid tibia without pd or pv ... Shaanxi, Yunnan .......................................
Chrysotimus qinlingensis Yang and Saigusa
­ Hind tarsomere 1 with about 20 black ventral basal bristles; mid tibia with 2 pd and 1 pv 21

21. Fore and mid tarsomere 1 without distinct v; epandrium basally with short process ( Fig. 42 ) ... Shaanxi ..........................................
Chrysotimus setosus Yang and Saigusa

­ Fore and mid tarsomere 1 each with row of 5–6 v; epandrium basally with long and acute process ( Fig. 54 ) ... Guangdong
............... Chrysotimus xiaohuangshanus
sp. nov.

22. Hind tarsomere 1 with 2–3 bundles of 14–15 black ventral bristles on basal 1/6 (which contains 1–2 small tight bundles and 1 large loose bundle); surstylus finger­like; hypandrium without apical incision ( Fig. 18 ) ... Yunnan ................................................ ........................................................................
Chrysotimus digitatus Yang and Saigusa
­ Hind tarsomere 1 with bundle of black ventral bristles; surstylus rather wide and thick; hypandrium with small apical incision ( Figs. 27 , 30 )................................................. 23

23. Hairs and bristles on thorax dark brown; hind tarsomere 1 with 15–16 black ventral bristles at base ... Yunnan ...........................
Chrysotimus pingbianus Yang and Saigusa

24. Hind tarsomere 1 with 12 black bristles; palpus dark brown; 8 irregularly paired acr; cercus with round apex ... Yunnan ....................
Chrysotimus incisus Yang and Saigusa

­ Hind tarsomere 1 with 7–8 black bristles; palpus yellow; 6 irregularly paired acr; cercus with acute apex ... Yunnan ..........................
Chrysotimus lijianganus Yang and Saigusa
